clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Mental Flexibility Through Language Tests in Adolescents With Frontal Brain Damage and in Healthy Children in Ages 8-17

oversight_info.authority: Israel: Israeli Health Ministry Pharmaceutical Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to shed light on the theoretical concept of mental flexibility and its manifestation in adolescents following frontal lobe damage, and to develop a test battery for young Hebrew speakers.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
clinical_study.condition: Persons With Frontal Lobe Damage With no Specific Language Disorder

study_pop.textblock: A group of children ages 8-17 with frontal lobe damage, who are treated at the children rehabilitation center at sheba medical center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- frontal lobe damage
- at least one year after injury
- native hebrew speaker
Exclusion Criteria:
- specific language disorder
- premorbid learning disability

facility.name: Children Rehabilitation Department Sheba Medical Center
